You quickly reach the boat, but you can't untiethe rope! Instantly the Rakas are upon you. Utter-ing angry cries, they fling their nets over you. Oneof them blindfolds you. Then they march youalong a winding, bumpy path. "Where are you taking me?" you ask. But theRakas ignore you, muttering angrily in their owntongue. Death seems certain. How will they executeyou? They seem to like ropes; maybe they willhang you.As you march on, hour after hour, the air turnscolder. You feel your strength ebbing. Finally the Rakas stop. Exhausted, you crum-ple to the ground. All is silent, and you fall into adeep sleep.
